verses.roman:
tomāra śikṣāya paḍi yena śuka-pāṭha
sākṣāt īśvara tumi, ke bujhe tomāra nāṭa

synonyms: tomāra śikṣāya—by Your instruction; paḍi—I recite; yena—like; śuka-pāṭha—the reciting of a parrot; sākṣāt—directly; īśvara—the Supreme Personality of Godhead; tumi—You; ke—who; bujhe—can understand; tomāra—Your; nāṭa—dramatic performance.
translation: "I simply repeat like a parrot whatever instructions You have given me. You are the Supreme Personality of Godhead Himself. Who can understand Your dramatic performances?
